website_summaries.verdict: If you need the ultimate rugged smartphone for globetrotting or tracking your dog’s location, this military-grade Instinct can survive any adventure.
pros: Pairs with smartphone for text alerts
Includes heart rate tracker and fitness apps
cons: Its monochrome screen isn’t for everyone

customer_reviews.title: Watch won’t recharge...only had 3 days.
customer_reviews.text: Loved the look and feel and was starting to learn all the capability when it ran out of charge. Now it will not hold a charge. Brand new and won’t hold a charge. Customer service got back to me with a reset procedure, but since watch won’t hold a charge, it can’t reset. I will change my review if fixed promptly, otherwise extremely disappointed in an almost $300 watch. June 8, 2019: Two different attempts with Support to reset the watch so it will operate and unsuccessful.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Band Sucks! (Update)
customer_reviews.text: Update: yesterday, started to itch and swelled up (see last photo) down graded to two stars. I’ve had multiple watches (suunto, Luminox, timex, gshock,etc) with silicon bands but this is the only one that gave me skin rash/bump. I want to keep the watch, so I’ll just have to start shopping for replacement band.
customer_reviews.author: Runner

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Product performed poorly. 1. GPS says sea level is 45 ft, while I was walking on the beach at Daytona Beach. This is after "calibrating" 3 times. 2. watch locked up in the middle of recording an activity. 3. watch won't re-start, stuck at the GARMIN logo. Returning the product. This is the second Garmin watch I had, that has failed. The first one, for Forerunner, lasted about 1 year and the buttons stopped working. This one, less than 40 days - failed. NEVER buying another Garmin product again. Going to an Apple Watch.
customer_reviews.author: E. Tu

customer_reviews.title: Positive surprise
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical initially, menu and usability felt unfriendly, its strap appeared bit flimsy (when compared to g-shock resin). After getting used to it and setting up the watch I simply love it. Comfy to wear 24/7, precise measurements, great battery life. Well balanced feature set. Garmin mobile App is fairly OK. I would recommend it to a friend certainly.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Band is toxic.
customer_reviews.text: Great watch, great functions, great battery life. Suck band. Make my skin red and swollen everytime after wearing. So cannot wear wholeday.
customer_reviews.author: PREZ

customer_reviews.title: Use with caution
customer_reviews.text: I have worn garmin products before and loved them. I got this for Christmas wore it for 2 wks, without any issues. Then i took it off to charge and i kept having discomfort on my wrist under the heartrate monitor area... it burned my wrist. I returned the watch and within 3 wks my wrist healed. I believe that something malfunctioned with this particular watch.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Zero stars
customer_reviews.text: Purchased “refurbished” because I did the same with another garmin I previously had , no issues. This time I opened the box to have a dirty watch with grime and what I can only guess is dead skin in all the grooves, like someone went for a run or a hike before they put it in the box to send... huge let down. Waiting for response , and I expect it to be replaced. If not I will return it immediately. ZERO STARS
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Check Region/Model Upon Arrival
customer_reviews.text: Watch out for APAC models (Asia Pacific). I noticed mine was an APAC when I plugged it into Garmin Express to sync/charge. I believe this affects future firmware updates from Garmin and possibly satellite connection times. Returned it since I'm in US. Other than that it's a great device. Very light. Very easy to read the display. Snappy and responsive. Quick to connect to phone app. Wrist HRM is so so but on par with other devices I've had.
customer_reviews.author: Ian cheddar

customer_reviews.title: Best smartwatch out there
customer_reviews.text: I have owned Rolex, Omega, Casio, Timex, and the Garmin Forerunner 935. Not to mention Apple Watch 4. The Garmin Instinct serves my needs better than any of them. Forget the naysayers. This is a high quality device that happens to be priced competitively. Get one, and learn how to customize the display -- you can't go wrong. It is deceptively powerful and nobody thinks you're wearing anything fancy. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: GB

customer_reviews.title: Refurnished watch not new.
customer_reviews.text: Buy the new Garmin Instinct Tactical watch, but it is refurnished, since the screen is not the Tactical screen. The truth is a shame and a disappointment. I can not believe how they want to sell something that is not what they offer or sell it as new and their parts are changed.
customer_reviews.author: Joaquín Pintos

customer_reviews.title: Asian Pacific Model NOT Rest of World Model
customer_reviews.text: This is the Asian Pacific (APAC) model, NOT Rest of the World (ROW) model. This explains why it's much cheaper here on Amazon, why the GPS is always off, and why firmware is always behind. Buy this watch elsewhere!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Watch but dont trust the colors.
customer_reviews.text: It is an awesome watch. Exactly what I was looking for, except for the color... The image doesnt really show you the real color, it differs to much from the original (in the case of the blue).
customer_reviews.author: Roberto A.

customer_reviews.title: buttons get stuck.  beware!
customer_reviews.text: loved it the first few months I had it but then the buttons began to get stuck. wasn't able to switch between the different modes or my light would get stuck on. finally gave up and sent it in to get fixed. they told me the issue was not covered under warranty so of course I had to pay for suunto to fix my watch, which I had for less than a year. got the watch back and it worked good for a few months but one of the buttons started to get stuck again. now the watch just sits in a box somewhere. buy something else!
customer_reviews.author: ser xiong

customer_reviews.title: Excellent watch in addition to  my Rolex
customer_reviews.text: Being 74 years old, it is good to have a watch that monitors my heart beat rate, daily steps taken and works with my phone to monitor calls, messages and daily health data. The GPS is a worthy part though I haven't use it yet. The bonus is the 7 day battery usage and don't have to recharge the watch daily. Unlike other expensive, branded watches the display is always on, no gimmicks and luminated at nighttime. The yellow one I have attracts attention too and easy to find when it is misplaced somewhere .
customer_reviews.author: ENJOYING LIFE

customer_reviews.title: Battery doesn't last more than 2 days : (
customer_reviews.text: Battery doesn't last more than 2 days even white heart monitor off and not using the GPS at all!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel de Alba

customer_reviews.title: Quit working after 2 days
customer_reviews.text: I gave this watch to my son for Christmas. On the 27th, the watch will only keep time, but all of the other functions have failed. He has tried to reset it multiple times with no success. This should NOT happen within 3 days.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Bettis

customer_reviews.title: Great watch with a retro style
customer_reviews.text: This is a rugged watch built for the outdoors. To me, it has that Casio G-Shock look to it which I enjoy to look at. The main screen is completely customizable with twelve different watch faces. Not as robust in features compared to the Fenix 5, but it is more durable which is what I was looking for. Great watch for someone who loves to hike and run.
customer_reviews.author: chris lowe

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in accuracy
customer_reviews.text: I love all the features that this watch comes with but the step tracker, heart rate monitor, and blood pressure monitor aren't accurate at all. The calories burned aspect is all over the place. I will have burned 800 calories shortly after wakimg up but only another 800 after an hour long intense workout. Sometimes my heart rate is 145 and then the very next second its 64. The app is a little hard to navigate. I do like that its water proof and the band seems to be withstanding a lot of stretching/pulling. If you're just looking for an estimate instead of actually tracking yourself, its a great watch, but if you're looking for accuracy and ease, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Lester

customer_reviews.title: Nice try Garmin
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your money. Heart rate isn’t accurate, settings are hard to function. I have had it just under a month and now the watch won’t charge. Tried to get away from Apple....but maybe having to go back.
customer_reviews.author: KatzMeow

customer_reviews.title: This is the one!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly enjoy the fact that it’s not touch screen. All the functions are easy to use. Very user friendly. Extremely easy to ready the screen. Connects to phones without a problem and like that it notifies me of messages and emails. Overall very useful and durable watch!
customer_reviews.author: Phill

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Watch !
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best watch yet. It is a great watch. I use it for three workouts - walking, bike riding and lifting weights. The apps for these excercises are great for a 74 yr old male. Buy it, you will not regret your purchase. It does it all.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: All fine except for the GPS accuracy
customer_reviews.text: I must say that I am quite disappointed with the GPS accuracy. On a measured 10 mile run it is always off by about a mile. Other than that, the watch is comfortable, looks good, and the heart rate monitor is very precise.
customer_reviews.author: Serge

customer_reviews.title: Battle tested
customer_reviews.text: This watch is bad***! I love it! Very durable and thats coming from a guy who has broken 1000s of dollars of government issued watches of all kinds. I don't go anywhere without this beast. On sea, air or land.
customer_reviews.author: Just a man

customer_reviews.title: sold the South East Asian version of the watch?
customer_reviews.text: The language on the box was not in Gnglish, but I saw no issue as I was able to change the watch language to English. Then I started having issues with the watch and contacted Garmin, turns out I received the South East Asian version of the watch....dang.... Garmin is a strong brand and hooked me up though. I learned my lesson and I will buy electronics only from the company who made them now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Price I paid to have these problems!
customer_reviews.text: Not happy with this Garmin!! Compass calibration keep dropping ! Temp can not find sensor! I would like a refund!! Cost way too much to have these problems.Not happy at all!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Total crap!!! Do not purchase this watch... GPS sucks !
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used the Garmin rugged plastic watch from china twice... My gps button sticks and the watch controls are absolutely terrible!!!! $300.00 bucks for a cheap $25 watch from China ....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Screen is taken by that stupid round display
customer_reviews.text: yes that round thing you see on the screen... it sticks! its horrible that you have to keep watching our monitor with that wasted space intruding on you.
customer_reviews.author: Rachna Chopra

customer_reviews.title: Great + cool looks and colors
customer_reviews.text: A great nice little connected watch. No gadgets (it's an outdoor watch you need to rely on) Perfect connection with the Garmin app, very visible display in the sun, very good battery life (depends if everything is connected 24/7). But for a "use and sync daily" ... very good. Datas (heart, steps, etc.) are reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Gilles Forestier

customer_reviews.title: MY husband LOVES this watch
customer_reviews.text: My husband has had several watches over the last few years and by far is thoroughly impressed with this Garmin. He loves the battery life and the solid rubber construction of this product. After killing 2 fitbit blazes and a cheap garmin step tracker he was looking for several features: accurate steps tracker, Long battery life, standalone GPS, and messaging notifications. This Garmin has all of them and he can't stop raving about it. He charges it once a week (doesn't use GPS often) and the battery lasts even with bluetooth enabled for notifications from his phone. Overall best value!
customer_reviews.author: Shanna U

customer_reviews.title: Great fitness watch
customer_reviews.text: I waited a few weeks before writing this review. I wanted a watch for hiking and swim tracking. The hiking activity in normal gps mode was super accurate. I used it on day hikes in a national park for about 6 hours. The battery lasted for a week before I had to charge again. The swim tracking also is adequate for someone who mostly uses freestyle. I love the look and the sturdiness of the watch! It was easy to connect to the app. Since this is my first Garmin it took some time to get used to the buttons. But once I got the hang of it, it has been super easy to navigate!
customer_reviews.author: Sneha

customer_reviews.title: Garbage product. It's less expensive than their other products for a reason.
customer_reviews.text: Garbage product. It's less expensive than their other products for a reason. Advertised battery life was delivered. Unfortunately that's about it for postives. The heart hate monitoring has been iffy at best. The distance tracking is off by more than a mile. And the altimeter if off by THOUSANDS of feet. Wife ran a race today that was 700 feet of elevation, watch said it was 4200 feet. Lost history of stored data after it updated. I feel ripped off. It's a horrible product. I would return if I wasn't 1 DAY outside the return window. Do not Buy!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research to find a well-priced watch with the works. I'm using it on hikes and other general workouts, and I'm really happy with it. I thought I would only wear it when hiking or working out, but I find myself wearing it most hours of the day. It's lightweight and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Katy Gilmore

customer_reviews.title: Matches description
customer_reviews.text: I have had the watch for only two days now, but it has worked great so far. The menu is easy to get used to and the battery is still fully charged. One of the biggest issues with smart watches anymore is the battery and this one appears to perform way above average so far. The frame of the watch stands out well above the glass, which will prevent the screen from taking damage. It connected right away to my phone and the rubber band is softer than standard. Great watch overalll so far.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah D

customer_reviews.title: Quality not as expected
customer_reviews.text: Watch has held up for the first week just fine. However, it feels cheap. It's very lightweight. When it vibrates, it's incredibly noisy. Never will this watch be a good idea in any type of noise sensitive environment such as hunting, church, meetings, etc. I dont know if its a flaw in this particular watch or just the watch in general. If someone else could give me feedback, i would appreciate it. The functions are fairly simple and easy to operate. Don't expect the ability to correspond back to messages, etc. The face of the watch could be better. With Garmin's technology, i guess i expected a bit more. I hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: BossHawg

customer_reviews.title: Did not even last a year
customer_reviews.text: If i spend $300 on a product, I expect it to not break down and force me to spend multiple afternoons waiting on technical support within a year. Garmin support is call, leave a number and wait for a callback and you have to be close to a computer white the watch. It worked great for the first 10 months, great battery life although that did begin to slip but then one day refused to acquire satellites. Did not even last a year, pathetic.
customer_reviews.author: Eoin McDonnell

customer_reviews.title: Fragile
customer_reviews.text: I've had the watch for a few months. Until yesterday my only complaint was the ring of fog on the watch face after I swam laps for the first time. My biggest complaint is that even with the Garmin glass protector on, the watch face cracked while I was gardening. At first I thought it was just a scratch, but at work noticed it has spread and covers half the face now. Going to contact Customer Service when they open and give them a chance to help. Will update review after.
customer_reviews.author: Katie1554

customer_reviews.title: Feels like tech from 2004
customer_reviews.text: Overall the watch feels cheap. The band was a harder plastic than I expected and was uncomfortable. The user interface is clunky and unintuitive. In the end, this watch, for all its promise, does little more for me than a G-Shock (that does not need to be recharged every week).
customer_reviews.author: Mr. X

customer_reviews.title: It has everything without the things you don't need
customer_reviews.text: This is my first amazon review, received nothing free and I wasn't asked to write this. The MGRS accuracy isfantastic, has features such as waypoints, gyro compass, weather forecast, altimeter, barometric pressure and the battery life is simply amazing. I honestly like NOT having a touch screen and prefer genuine buttons to push, it is much tougher than anything in Fenix line, this watch was built to last. Garmin is actively supporting it with frequent firmware updates as well. It's just a great outdoor watch, especially for hiking, camping, geocaching and things like that. I can input a grid as a destination FROM THE WATCH, and it works just fine, without a phone connection.
customer_reviews.author: Boymom183

customer_reviews.title: Not a smart watch!
customer_reviews.text: Update: I received a firmware update for the watch and I followed the instructions to do it, update was successful but after that nothing was working! I had to reset the watch and start from zero!!! As for now it seems to work but not sure for how long it will be working! Here's my honest opinion about this watch! First of all it is not what I expected! This is a tracker watch, if you look for a smart watch this not for you! The features of this watch are for fitness people! It's a good looking watch, but totally useless as I'm not working out! I'm not planning on returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Freddy Cassara

customer_reviews.title: A swiss army knife for your wrist.
customer_reviews.text: I love the watch... battery life is amazing.... and there are still things I discover every day... I've gone scuba diving... mountain climbing and lots of work...it just keeps on ticking.... I've banged the watch into a rough concrete wall and said the proverbial "That's gonna leave a mark!" But nope...still looks new.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Sands

customer_reviews.title: Not working
customer_reviews.text: The first day worked great then the pulse function stopped working then the message alerts from the phone stopped working I reset the watch a few times but it still didn’t work It’s too bad since the time function was great and the watch was very comfortable to wear I sent it back
customer_reviews.author: Usa

customer_reviews.title: Shockingly horrible user interface!
customer_reviews.text: Typical crappy Garmin user interface. I’m fed up with Garmin. I returned this less than average watch and I will never consider Garmin again.
customer_reviews.author: DN & AN

customer_reviews.title: Only thing it accurately tracks is the time!
customer_reviews.text: Battery life is the only reason it received a single star. It fails miserably at tracking steps, heart rate, sleep, intensity minutes, or anything else remotely accurately. I spent $300 on a “rugged” time keeping device. Don’t buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Abercrombie

customer_reviews.title: GREAT GARMIN PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: I own several different Garmin products and thus far ALL are excellent products. They perform admirably under all conditions and not one of them has failed me yet. The Garmin INSTINCT, I have to say, is now at the top of my list. It's rugged, looks great, and does everything it claims to do at a price that I no one should really complain about. I was tempted to buy the Fenix Sapphire, but the price just seemed to be too much. GARMIN got it right with the INSTINCT!
customer_reviews.author: Karl P

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but works
customer_reviews.text: Does what its suppose to. Gps is spot on. Battery life is amazing. Takes maybe 10-20 to charge. Heart rate monitor may change depending on how snug you have it. Additional apps such as weather and moon cycle help too. Band is good quality and comfortable. Some water on it will be enough to wipe any sweat residue on it. A good all-in-one sports watch. It shows no sign of breakage at my point, so I assume the 'rugged' quality is up to standard. I recommend getting a small screen protector for the face just in case due to the product's rather high cost.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Hubby Love this.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband for Christmas 2018. He upgraded to the Garmin Instinct watch from a Suunto. My husband is an athlete and a SWAT sniper. This watch is very rugged and stands up to anything you do to it in some pretty harsh conditions. We live in a hot area so I can not attest to how it works in extreme cold but we frequently have weather in excess of 100 degrees here. He LOVES it. It connects to an app that tracks your sleep, etc... also he says that the battery lasts about 2 weeks on a single charge which is twice as long as the Suunto lasted.
customer_reviews.author: BeckyW

customer_reviews.title: Warning - APAC version!
customer_reviews.text: The lower price of this item is evidently because it is the Asia Pacific version. This is not necessarily a deal-breaker because it has an English menu as well as Thai, Bahasa, Vietnamese, etc, and it seems to work well. But it came with firmware v2.90 when the latest release is v8.60. Using the Garmin Express app, I updated to the latest available version for this APAC model - v7.10. So I'm still behind the latest. I fault the vendor for not making clear that this is not a ROW model, and may decide to return it.
customer_reviews.author: C. D. Lynn

customer_reviews.title: If your outdoors. Solar is better
customer_reviews.text: Battery lasts incredibly long and tracks everything you need. The solar I’ve seen it charge the battery up a full day just being outside for 10ish hours.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor yocum

customer_reviews.title: Great watch!!
customer_reviews.text: What a great watch, run tracking, timer for swimming, tracking my hikes, walks, yoga.. honestly just about everything. Also it looks great. I've been using this watch for about a month now and am in love with it. Battery life is really good, full charge lasts me about 4 days, I use the gps function often though so I'm sure it would last longer if you didnt use it. Beauty thing about the battery is it only takes about an hour to charge. I like the Garmin connect platform it links to on my phone, updates quickly. Links to strava as well. I would definitely buy this watch again. I spent a long time researching, very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Andre

customer_reviews.title: Excellent wearable. Would strongly recommend this to my friends.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this garmin to replace the lack luster Fitbit charge 3. Having used it for approximately 10 days I can already tell the step count is much more accurate and the battery life way better. I do like the mobile app, but I feel the sleep portion could provide a but more information. I particularly like the fact that I can call my heart rate to my wahoo app to get better work out stats. That's another plus, the heart rate seems much more accurate with the Garmin.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Smith

customer_reviews.title: Very good sports watch
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this watch for about 4 months now and it has performed great. Biking, hiking, walking, running, and paddleboard tracking have all worked well. I did experience some issue with using the Ultra Trac GPS mode during a hike - it didn't provide good tracking in heavy tree cover up switchbacks. But the other GPS modes have all worked great, they just consume battery a little faster. The battery life has been great, and I can usually get by for a week or two between charging.
customer_reviews.author: Brett from TX

customer_reviews.title: Defective on arrival
customer_reviews.text: I received this item today. It was defective on arrival. The watch appears to have been returned or used by some one. I called garmin and the customer service tech told me this watch I received was connected to another account. I couldn’t log into the garmin because of this. Another user was already attached this watch. The heart rate monitor had no seal sticker as the tech asked me to check. I will be returning this defective watch back to amazon and the third party seller.
customer_reviews.author: Md80driver

customer_reviews.title: Good for casual athletic activities
customer_reviews.text: I live in a rural area so smartphone apps that claim to track physical activity are not accurate due to few cell phone towers. This watch does a far better job. There are limitations in terms of live location viewing via the smartphone app -- so this is not a good tool if you are looking for land navigation. If you are interested in tracking your outdoor activities, this watch does a reasonably good job at that.
customer_reviews.author: Champs McGee

customer_reviews.title: Awesome watch !!
customer_reviews.text: Hey , I never owned a Garmin Watch before and I have owned other types like the Apple Watch, Gshock , etc. But this Garmin Instinct is incredible!! Can I say first of all that it was delivered before the scheduled delivery date and on my birthday!!!! Pairing the watch w/ my iPhone was a breeze, the app is responsive. I haven’t tested the gps capabilities yet and the number of apps that come preinstalled but today I’m going for a run to see how this watch responds with all the data I’m going to record. Look, if you are looking for a rugged watch w gps capabilities for hiking,skiing , etc. Look no further.
customer_reviews.author: Keitell

customer_reviews.title: So far, fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I've had this watch for a few weeks now, and I'm only beginning to realize its full capabilities. Just did a 10 mile run and linked the watch to Strava and the accuracy was spot-on. Heart rate monitor, weather, elevation, and activity tracking have all been impressive so far. Watch is super comfortable and not ridiculously bulky. Doesn't look super "techy" like the Apple Watch either. The real test is going to come when I go on a three night camping trip in the mountains in a few weeks. I'm eager to see how the GPS and waypoint navigating work deep in the mountains.
customer_reviews.author: jacob

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: If you are interested in a watch that does awesome stuff and not a mini smart phone on your wrist, this is the watch. It's not fancy or colorful. It doesn't do the tricks that lose their luster after three or four uses. It's barely stylish. But what it does, it is simply the best at. Flawless step counting. Amazing weeks long battery life. Fully customizable display. Very accurate and smooth heart rate measurement. Flawless phone connectivity. Perfect app integration. If you love running, this is the watch for you. Or, if you hate running but still have to do it because the Army makes you, it's the right choice for you. Great job Garmin.
customer_reviews.author: brad

customer_reviews.title: Worst Watch on the Market
customer_reviews.text: I had to give this a one since there was nothing less. First it would not pair with my phone. The phone app could not find the watch. The instructions that came with the phone are terrible. Do not buy this watch. Look for a better product.
customer_reviews.author: John Seiler

customer_reviews.title: Spot on watch
customer_reviews.text: This watch is pretty cool and the fact that it can receive the messages from your phone like a smart watch is awesome. it is made from very durable material. the only thing that is off on this thing is the step I would say. IF you shake your hand it counts your steps verse using the gps. however the watch does count accurately while preforming activities. I also swim with it everyday and it hold up but wont read your HR. non the less the app for the watch and the watch it self is awesome and I took this over a apple watch and would continue to do the same anyday.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with some of the features
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this watch but it has failed on a couple of features. First, the light on the watch is so dim that it is almost useless. Configuration and the methods used to get from one feature to another are also difficult. I am very disappointed overall but will keep it and continue to try to learn more about how to deal with the configuration. The GPS does seem to do a pretty good job of tracking which is the only reason I will keep it. Now, on to searching for another smart watch that suites my needs.
customer_reviews.author: PBW

customer_reviews.title: Great watch for the price, and TOUGH
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a watch that had GPS so I could run without hauling my phone around all the time. As much as I liked the Apple watch it did not seem as rugged After almost a year, this thing has been in the ocean 100's of times, pools, banged into concrete, has some wear marks on it, but it still works. I even use the buttons underwater which is normally a no no on a watch, and no issues. No it's not a color HD screen, but it does what it does well. Don't expect this thing to provide guidance if your in space, it has a purpose and it does that purpose well..
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Seriously good outdoors watch
customer_reviews.text: I waited a couple months to write this review so I could put the watch through my daily life and see how it performed. I'm continually impressed. I don't use GPS a lot so I charge it once a week and there's plenty of battery life left to make it at least twice as long. The face is easy to read in all light conditions. It's as tough as my old school casio. But the real beauty is the app. The app is FLAWLESS, it tracks everything and doesn't run down your phone battery. If you want a seriously good outdoor watch without the nonsense, this is the one.
customer_reviews.author: David 7089

customer_reviews.title: So far, a great product
customer_reviews.text: A great hiking watch -- near perfect, except: 1) HR works fine except registers only half during strenuous exercise and 2) sleep tracking drops out at times for short periods and does not account for naps. If (wrist) HR rate is of primary importance this watch may be a bad choice. If you need GPS maps (I use my phone for that) you may want the Fenix. The ABC functions are super, as is battery life. The watch is amazingly customizable. Makes hiking easier, safer, and more enjoyable.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Murray

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT receive text notifications on iOS 13
customer_reviews.text: Watch looks great, does everything it needs to, besides one BIG reason why I got this watch from the beginning. WILL NOT RECEIVE TEXT MESSAGE ALERTS! I’ve done everything I found online, but literally nothing works. I read in a few places that it is because of the IOS 13 update. Ever since they updated their phones, they stopped receiving text notification. If I would’ve known this before purchasing, I wouldn’t have purchased because I had already done the update. Other than that, I loved everything else about it. But will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin D

customer_reviews.title: Seems pretty good to me
customer_reviews.text: Imagine my delight on Christmas morning when I opened the Garmin Instinct, Rugged Outdoor Watch with GPS, Features GLONASS and Galileo, Heart Rate Monitoring! Never more will I wander the wilderness. Never more will I wonder about my heart rate! This Garmin Instinct, Rugged Outdoor Watch with GPS, Features GLONASS and Galileo, Heart Rate Monitoring has given me the confidence to climb the highest mountain, swim the swiftest river and navigate the most rugged terrain!
customer_reviews.author: M. Pratt

customer_reviews.title: Great watch for active person. Love tracking all activities.
customer_reviews.text: Love the watch, but some things don’t work as great as expected. The hiking app will not work correctly, during auto pause, which is a major inconvenience, since we stop a lot to enjoy our surroundings. Navigating through it takes some time to learn, esp if not used a lot. Have to google lots of different things, in order to change almost anything. Overall, I’m very happy with it, just expected it to be a tad bit better. Appears to be very durable. Love that it links to the Garmin connect app and keeps track of all your stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Nell

customer_reviews.title: Too complicated and not intuitive
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like his watch and it gets very good reviews but it’s just not intuitive. There are so many features and each one requires multiple steps to engage. I used it to track a few hikes and a float and it seems accurate. The “storm alert” is not reliable and often announced during cloudless days but never alerted when there was an actual storm nearby. Also the app is pretty good. It is a handsome watch, has a comfortable band, and is very light but you can get that in a $40 Timex.
customer_reviews.author: DXer99

customer_reviews.title: Great sports watch
customer_reviews.text: I really like my watch. It’s perfect for a more rugged lifestyle. I e taken it to the river in the ozarks multiple times and jumped off cliffs with it on, stuff like that, and it never falls off plus the battery life is AMAZING!!!! Lasts me about a week at a time! I never worry about breaking it or accidentally hitting it on things. The activities are what I was most interested in and I’d say I love them all except for the “Strength” one because I don’t think it’s very accurate at all otherwise I’m not using it right when I lift weights. Everything else is great!
customer_reviews.author: Karen Moore

customer_reviews.title: Excellent watch. Be sure you know what you're getting and you will love it!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent watch, that's fairly easy to create your own activities. I use it for Paragliding and the altimeter and speed are very accurate and the battery life is fantastic. Plus benefits of my former G-Shock watches. Highly recommend. I did get a little frustrated getting used to what the buttons did, especially when creating my own activity. My recommendation is to save the custom activity right after naming it, then edit the activity to finish creating it. That will save some frustration when creating activities. Other than that this watch is 100% perfect for me. Keep in mind it doesn't have a touch screen or accept custom apps from the Garmin store, but I don't even miss those.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon H

customer_reviews.title: Rugged
customer_reviews.text: I needed a tracker that would work in cold temps and high altitude. My Samsung Fit2 would stop working at about 9,000' (not even that high) and in barely freezing temps. That's why I got this rugged best. Sure it's not touch and is monochrome, but those aren't as important as the tracker working while I am. Battery life is amazing: barely a dent in battery life on a 3 hour bike ride, and last all day tracking a hike. Only complaint is on a multi-day hike I can't use a standard USB cable, but have to carry the proprietary one to recharge.
customer_reviews.author: Heath Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Poor battery longevity
customer_reviews.text: I loved this watch for the first 2 months. The battery life was awesome. I loved tracking my workouts, kayaking trips and hikes. Then the battery life plummeted to one day capacity. I turned off all the tracking features and Bluetooth connections. Still the battery doesn’t last more than a day. I’m very unsatisfied with this purchase and will be looking at another watch brand
customer_reviews.author: David A. Resendez

customer_reviews.title: Love this watch. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: I migrated from Apple Watch v3 to the Instinct. It is much simpler to use (once you get the setup complete). This is my go to watch and I rarely use mu Apple Watch anymore. It is comfortable, has a great battery life, and has many features that are better suited for activity over the Apple. I do miss the color screen and the ability to answer an iphone but these feature are over come by the look, feel, and other features of the Instinct.
customer_reviews.author: TjM

customer_reviews.title: battery started acting up after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: for the first two months the device worked fine and I has getting approximately a 10 to 12 day battery life. after two months however battery started draining within 24hrs. this is after disabling smart notifications, Bluetooth and not using GPS . better to get a Fitbit for a few dollars more because they don't do false advertising
customer_reviews.author: DPK

customer_reviews.title: Awesome watch!
customer_reviews.text: Been using it for two months now, and I just love it. I used to have an Apple Watch, but I got tired of the battery life lasting like a day, this watch (Garmin Instinct) can go for days without charging, going to the gym, doing weights and cardio is great on tracking, love the design. I can even find my phone, just like the Apple Watch. Maybe some would say it’s a little big for my wrist for I just love it! Maybe just maybe would prefer the black one, because everything I use is black, but the grey is actually really cool.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Avoid - Problematic design
customer_reviews.text: The buttons are mounted such that there is no way to avoid pressing them with a shirt sleeve, glove edge, or just moving the wrist its on. This leads to turning the GPS on which drains the batteries in a few hours. I don't recommend this watch and I would not buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Vicster

customer_reviews.title: One year later
customer_reviews.text: After owning this watch for a year I am still happy with it. The Garmin Connect with my phone is a great tool as it makes reading the information on my watch instantaneous and of course easier to see on a full sized Android phone. It is important to keep the software updates on both compatible or it will lose connection. Just hooking up your watch to your laptop and running Garmin Connect this is easy to do. This is my second watch by Garmin. My first was a Tactical which lasted 4 years of rough use. The software on this one is easier to navigate through and the Garmin Connect with the new Instinct is smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Ed L.

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Durable
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this watch in and between 4 different continents and the GPS has worked everywhere. I have worn it in the oceans, cold environments, hot environments and it’s even been in temperatures of over 500 degrees F for a short period of time. I have put this watch through hell with hard physical punishment and it still performs as advertised and not a single scratch on the screen. With no connectivity to phones or GPS I have gone around 28 days without charging it. The altimeter works great and is very accurate but has lag when quickly ascending or descending (flying in a helicopter). Garmin has exceeded my expectations in every way with this watch. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Dillon Carll

customer_reviews.title: Great watch for what I need.. my occupation is prob the issue
customer_reviews.text: Working in construction I basically just needed a rugged watch that could stand the abuse, elements and have good battery life while feeding me important info without taking my phone out as much.. This watch does all of these tasks very well.. Its also very light and comfortable. HOWEVER, while driving commercial trucks/heavy equipment, itll register as not only walking, but climbing flights of stairs.. So I'm smashing fitness goals without actually doing any fitness! the same goes for the heart rate sensor. I dont honestly use much else and my old Samsung watch had these similar draw backs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Must own for active person
customer_reviews.text: Has all the features one could ask for minus 1 (the pay feature for those that use Apple pay/Google pay/Samsung pay). Went from the Vivoactive HR to this. The Instinct does not have a touch screen, that take a bit to get used too going through all of the buttons. Besides the minor learning curve, the ruggedness of the Instinct > Vivoactive HR. For those that are active ( Cycling, Kayaking, tactical), this is the Garmin for you
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Great for hiking and active people
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t used it to track my sleep. I use it mostly hiking and swimming. I wore it everyday for a couple months. The battery typically lasted a week with some frequent exercise tracking. Now I only wear it when doing something active. It’s a sturdy watch and has gotten banged around and no scratches or damage of any kind. The wrist strap is comfortable. It takes some time to learn the watch as it has many functions and screens. The gps distance isn’t perfect but it’s great for hiking to get an estimate. This watch is a great and I’d recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Chang

customer_reviews.title: Nice Watch
customer_reviews.text: It's good. It's the same size as a GShock so if you aren't looking for something giant with a color map (or really any map as I don't count the breadcrumb feature as a map) then this watch is nice. I'd wait to catch a sale though as it's not worth the list price advertised on Amazon most of the time. The price seems to fluctuate pretty often so it shouldn't be hard finding a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: G-Shock of smart watches!
customer_reviews.text: As seen in another review. If you are a fan of G-Shocks this is the smart watch you need! Has all features for outdoors including the basics like steps and HR. The HR is very accurate to, and the stuff like step counter and compass are cool! You can also set it to receive messages, weather alerts and customize what you want to use. The only thing I wish was there was more face options and a better way to customize the options you scroll through. Other then that though it's truly a great watch! (this does not have touch screen)
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: A Great Every Day Watch
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this watch for the GPS functions and they work fairly good. My biggest gripe is the menu buttons and selections on the watch. It's hard to remember which button controls what because there is so many selections. Other than the confusing menu selections I'm happy with the watch.
customer_reviews.author: Harley R.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent "Smart-ish" Watch for outdoors
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for what I needed. Wanted a watch that would vibrate when I got notifications on my phone because I regularly silence my phone in meetings. Battery life is great lasting just shy of 2 weeks. I did not want a smartwatch that I had to plug in daily or every other day. Fitness app isnt something I was looking for but it works well and tracks my runs which is nice! Durability seems serviceable. I work outside, digging in the dirt and have had no issues. Basically it does everything I need and a little more!
customer_reviews.author: Jake Monti

customer_reviews.title: Great Garmin watch
customer_reviews.text: Quite hesitant to buy this product off of Amazon, but their price was the lowest at the time. This was a birthday gift for my boyfriend - he absolutely loves it. He’s had it for about a month and has had to charge it only twice. He used it on a hike recently and was very impressed. I personally like the rugged look of the watch. Bought this because it had great reviews and it definitely did not disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Sovey

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Garmin Yet
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd Garmin and by far my favorite one yet. I'm a woman and it fits a little big, but stylishly big. The most important thing is the tracking. It's so easy to use, the analytics are great, and the battery life is out of this world good. My favorite feature is that it's not touch screen, so it doesn't start and full up applications when you're changing clothes or brush against it. I highly recommend for the multi-sport outdoor enthusiast who wants one watch to do everything.
customer_reviews.author: Madeline

customer_reviews.title: Home run
customer_reviews.text: Great watch, not a huge fan of heavy metal watches but this watch is so light, doesn’t even feel like you have it on half the day, very comfortable. The features are plenty everything works smoothly. Paired with the connect app gives you all the info you will need. The fitness activities are great way to push yourself and track what you have accomplished. Can’t wait for warmer weather to break in this watch. Battery life is also pretty amazing I’m a week and a half in on a 20 min charge and it still has 3/5 bars of battery. Would buy another if they come out with a newer model down the line!
customer_reviews.author: Adam Krempec

customer_reviews.title: Very Practical
customer_reviews.text: I work in a machine shop and work out 4+ days a week and I basically never have to take this thing off. It's super tough, comfortable, lightweight, and you can clean it off with yourself in the shower. Would recommend to anyone who needs a watch that's useful in the gym and in the office (seeing notifications at a glance on your watch instead of having to pull out your phone with dirty hands is a game-changer).
customer_reviews.author: Richard Baron

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 6 months then quit working
customer_reviews.text: The first 6 months of owning this I loved it, now it won't even charge or power on completely. Never dropped it or wore it in water, just quit working. Waste of money. Went online to see how I could fix it because it just powers on to show garmin screen with a triangle error but will not do anything else. Tried following suggestions on Garmin site but still won't work.
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah Smith

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this watch. It's sturdy and tracks steps and exercise well. Sometimes it doesn't track sleep the best: I have to adjust the "fall asleep" time. The watch band is causing some irritation on my wrist, though. I don't sweat excessively while wearing the watch and I don't shower with it so I don't know what could be causing irritation. I'll probably buy a different band/strap eventually. The watch as a whole is amazing. I love not having to charge it hardly at all.
customer_reviews.author: J. Porter

customer_reviews.title: Amazing and comfortable trail running watch
customer_reviews.text: I love the comfort on my wrist. The data is terrific and I am still learning all it's functions. I am very happy I purchased this watch. I had the Garmin 220 previously. The watch is synced with my mobile phone and I can get alerts. The GPS is working well in the forests and mountains of the Cascade Mountain Range. Highly recommend this watch.
customer_reviews.author: Alpine Skye

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I am so in love with this watch that I may sleep with it ;-) Just received it and getting used to all the features. Printed the pdf manual from the Garmin website and watching multiple Youtube videos. It is better than I expected so far! I did purchase a combo package of a silicone case and 2 screen protectors and was glad I did. I will edit this review if I have any problems that I am unable to resolve. BTW I bought this from the seller Amazon, not one of the other shippers.
customer_reviews.author: W. E.

customer_reviews.title: GPS issue FIXED, locks on to my destination whether I'm moving or not
customer_reviews.text: I have been assisting my wife with coral research where I need to save the location of specific corals. Previously, I needed to be moving at a good clip to get the arrow to point me to my destination. This was not possible while snorkeling. The latest software update fixed this and I now follow the heading right to the coral within 5 or 10 feet (close enough). Everything else is awesome. The interface is pretty involved but give it some time and with a bit of practice you'll quickly get to the features you need.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Love this Watch
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch to replace a Fitbit that failed after only two years. I chose this watch for its durability and the fact it is waterproof. So far I have not been disappointed. I mainly want to monitor my heart rate and ‘this watch is head and shoulders better on that score. As far as being a smart watch I don’t see that it is that much better than a Fitbit. If you want a durable activity tracker, I highly recommend this watch.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth L. Boekhaus

customer_reviews.title: Would not connect
customer_reviews.text: I really like this watch, but the fact remains it would not connect to my phone. I have a oneplus 7t. Actually let me rephrase that. I would say it was connected to my phone, but notifications would not get pushed through to my watch. I did all troubleshooting instructions, but with no luck. I've sold cell phones for 10 years now, so I would believe that my knowledge would be enough to properly connect. After some research, it seems the only way you can connect to some phones if you go down a software patch. If this is the case, then that more than likely means Garmin isn't updating their watches to work across all OS software patches.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Wilkinson

customer_reviews.title: Great multi function watch at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: Owned a fenix 3 for several years and was very pleased with it. Bought this one on sale for $200 and very pleased with the look, functionality, and fast processor (much faster than the fenix 3). I use it for gym workouts, hiking, alerts, weather, etc., etc. It is an excellent watch at a great value. Does most of the functions of the newest most expensive Garmin multi function watches at a 3rd of the price. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Awesome watch
customer_reviews.text: I had a Pebble, Huawei, and Samsung smartwatch. This is by far the best of the bunch for overall functionality. Granted this is for a particular type of person which I am. Use it to mark where I parked the truck when scouting a hunting ground, or to track my mountain bike ride. It is durable enough I wear it cutting concrete, cleaning equipment, or anything else my job or home life requires.
customer_reviews.author: FeelinFroggy

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted!
customer_reviews.text: I am a fan of garmin watches. I had an older version for a couple of years. It worked fine, but the heart sensor protruded and was uncomfortable after hours of wearing. The Garmin Instinct is definitely living up to my expectations so far. Very durable, long battery life, and a huge improvement from my old one. It is also much more comfortable and lightweight. Too many benefits to count!
customer_reviews.author: Dan Radke

customer_reviews.title: Awesome fitness device and watch
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product. The included instructions are vague but garman has many instruction sites and videos. I am not tech savvy but with a little patients I have learned how to use it. I use it mainly for biking and monitoring my fitness but it has so many other functions that I am just discovering. I also use it as my primary watch. It's sturdy and not like I'm walking around with a cell phone on my wrist.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great watch, 2 week re-charge
customer_reviews.text: Great watch, I bought it because of the long time between battery re-charge (2 weeks) and 16 h GPS re-charge. Used in when hiking in New Zealand. Use it every day to track other activities including sleep through Garmin's iPhone app The only downside, it takes a bit to get used to the interface, wish Garmin had more specific videos on their website. You can find other vidoes online that explain certain functions. Not all. Overall still a great watch, highly recommned for outdoor activities.
customer_reviews.author: Olimpiu

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I need
customer_reviews.text: Rugged & functional, no frills reliability. I love that uses buttons instead of the usual unreliable and unpredictable touchscreen (like when you're wet or sweaty). Also, the display is always on, which is very usual at the gym or in situations where you just want to give it a quick glance, like when I ride my dirt bike. GPS fix happens much quicker than any other Vivoactive I had before, and the battery lasts forever (I used it for two full weeks before charging it, and there were two bars left, still). Highly customizable, it does not work with Garmin Connect add-on apps but I don't feel it needs any, really.
customer_reviews.author: Ambrosioni Pietro

product_meta.title: Garmin Instinct, Rugged Outdoor Watch with GPS, Features GLONASS and Galileo, Heart Rate Monitoring and 3-Axis Compass, Graphite
product_meta.description: Style Name:Instinct| Color:GraphiteWhen you can rely on Instinct, the world can rely on you. This rugged, reliable outdoor GPS watch is built to the U. S. Military standard 810G for thermal, shock and water resistance (Rated to 100 meters). The fiber-reinforced polymer case adds strength and durability, and the chemically-strengthened, scratch-resistant display is high-contrast enough to read in bright sunlight, so you can take it with you into the extremes you face every day. Plus, the fully vented silicone bands include two independent, removable keeper loops to ensure a secure fit and to keep you from getting caught on things. Water rating: 10 ATM.
feature_bullets: Rugged GPS watch built to withstand the toughest environments
Constructed to U.S. Military standard 810G for thermal, shock and water resistance (rated to 100 meters)
Built in 3 axis compass and barometric altimeter, plus multiple global navigation satellite systems (GPS, Glonass and Galileo) support helps track in more challenging environments than GPS alone
Monitor your estimated heart rate, activity and stress; Train with preloaded activity profiles. Strap material: Silicone
Stay connected with smart notifications (with a compatible smartphone) and automatic data uploads to the Garmin connect online fitness community
Use the trackback feature to navigate the same route back to your starting point; Use the Garmin explore website and app to plan your trips in advance
Battery life: Up to 14 days in smartwatch mode, up to 16 hours in GPS mode, up to 40 hours in Ultratrac battery saver mode

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars5,620 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
specifications.Additional Features: 810G Thermal, Shock, and Water Resistance; Up to 100m Water Resistance; 3-Axis Compass and Barometric Altimeter
